trans-unit.source: How to Create a Media Processor | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Create a Media Processor | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a media processor component to encode, convert format, encrypt, or decrypt media content for Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a media processor component to encode, convert format, encrypt, or decrypt media content for Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.
trans-unit.target: Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.

trans-unit.source: How to: Get a Media Processor Instance
trans-unit.target: How to: Get a Media Processor Instance

trans-unit.source: In Media Services a media processor is a component that handles a specific processing task, such as encoding, format conversion, encrypting, or decrypting media content.
trans-unit.target: In Media Services a media processor is a component that handles a specific processing task, such as encoding, format conversion, encrypting, or decrypting media content.

trans-unit.source: You typically create a media processor when you are creating a task to encode, encrypt, or convert the format of media content.
trans-unit.target: You typically create a media processor when you are creating a task to encode, encrypt, or convert the format of media content.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides the name and description of each available media processor.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides the name and description of each available media processor.

trans-unit.source: Lets you run encoding tasks using the Azure Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: Lets you run encoding tasks using the Azure Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: Lets you run encoding tasks using the Media Encoder Standard.
trans-unit.target: Lets you run encoding tasks using the Media Encoder Standard.

trans-unit.source: Lets you run encoding tasks using Media Encoder Premium Workflow.
trans-unit.target: Lets you run encoding tasks using Media Encoder Premium Workflow.

trans-unit.source: Enables you to make media files and content searchable, as well as generate closed captioning tracks and keywords.
trans-unit.target: Enables you to make media files and content searchable, as well as generate closed captioning tracks and keywords.

trans-unit.source: Enables you to smooth out the "bumps" in your video with video stabilization.
trans-unit.target: Enables you to smooth out the "bumps" in your video with video stabilization.

trans-unit.source: Also allows you to speed up your content into a consumable clip.
trans-unit.target: Also allows you to speed up your content into a consumable clip.

trans-unit.source: Lets you decrypt media assets that were encrypted using storage encryption.
trans-unit.target: Lets you decrypt media assets that were encrypted using storage encryption.

trans-unit.source: Lets you convert media assets from .mp4 to smooth streaming format.
trans-unit.target: Lets you convert media assets from .mp4 to smooth streaming format.

trans-unit.source: Also, lets you convert media assets from smooth streaming to the Apple HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) format.
trans-unit.target: Also, lets you convert media assets from smooth streaming to the Apple HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) format.

trans-unit.source: Task Preset Strings for the Azure Media Packager
trans-unit.target: Task Preset Strings for the Azure Media Packager

trans-unit.source: Lets you encrypt media assets using PlayReady Protection.
trans-unit.target: Lets you encrypt media assets using PlayReady Protection.

trans-unit.source: Task Preset Strings for the Azure Media Packager
trans-unit.target: Task Preset Strings for the Azure Media Packager

trans-unit.source: The following method shows how to get a media processor instance.
trans-unit.target: The following method shows how to get a media processor instance.

trans-unit.source: The code example assumes the use of a module-level variable named **_context** to reference the server context as described in the section [How to: Connect to Media Services Programmatically].
trans-unit.target: The code example assumes the use of a module-level variable named **_context** to reference the server context as described in the section [How to: Connect to Media Services Programmatically].

trans-unit.source: Now that you know how to get a media processor instance, go to the [How to Encode an Asset][] topic which will show you how to use the Azure Media Encoder to encode an asset.
trans-unit.target: Now that you know how to get a media processor instance, go to the [How to Encode an Asset][] topic which will show you how to use the Azure Media Encoder to encode an asset.
